part2.question: Describe a friend you have known for a long time.
part2.model_answer: I want to introduce my best friend, Li, who has been my classmate for five years. He is incredibly funny and loyal. Since we share the same sense of humor, we never run out of things to talk about, although he is sometimes late. He always offers me Supportive [支持的] advice when I am stressed. We have a strong bond of Intimacy [亲密]. He is the most Considerate [体贴的] person I know. We enjoy playing video games together. He is like a brother to me. I value his Companionship [陪伴] deeply. I hope we stay Inseparable [形影不离的] forever. He is a major part of my Childhood [童年].

part2.question: Describe a friend who has played an important role in your life.
part2.model_answer: I clearly remember my friend Sarah, who helped me through a tough time. She was very Supportive [支持的] when I failed my exams. Because she stuck by me Through thick and thin [风雨同舟], I realized she was a true friend, which gave me courage. We Hit it off [一见如故] immediately when we met. She is very Considerate [体贴的] of my feelings. Our Companionship [陪伴] means the world to me. She taught me to be strong. I am lucky to have such an Intimate [亲密的] friend. She is my role model and always gives me joy. Her advice is always spot on and very helpful.

part2.question: Describe a friend who is talented at music or singing.
part2.model_answer: I have a friend called Tom who plays the guitar beautifully. He is very talented and Hilarious [极滑稽的] when he performs. Although he is shy, he comes alive on stage, because music is his passion. We often sing together, which is Joyful [快乐的]. He is never Superficial [肤浅的] about his fame. We have been Inseparable [形影不离的] since Childhood [童年]. His music brings people together. I admire his dedication. He is a Considerate [体贴的] bandmate. His songs are very popular at school. He might Drift apart [逐渐疏远] if he becomes famous, but I hope not. It is a pleasure to know him and hear his music.

part3.question: What is the difference between friendships at work and those outside of work?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] Usually, work friends are more formal and distant. [Reason] Relationships with a Colleague [同事] can be Superficial [肤浅的] because you compete for promotions or salary raises in the same company. [Example] Unless you meet outside the office, the Interaction [互动] remains professional only. True Companionship [陪伴] is deeper outside work because you can be yourself fully without worrying about your job.

part3.question: At what age do you think people start to have friendships?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] I suppose that it starts in early Childhood [童年]. [Reason] Toddlers begin to play together, forming the first Universal [普遍的] social bonds of their lives, which are simple and pure. [Example] Since they are Inseparable [形影不离的] at the park, they learn sharing and trust. It is instinct for them to seek connection with peers early on.

part3.question: Do you think music is beneficial for children at school?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] Unquestionably, it aids Psychological [心理的] development. [Reason] Music is a Universal [普遍的] language that helps kids express feelings they cannot say clearly or easily in words. [Example] When they sing together, it promotes unity and happiness in class. It helps them find friends and build confidence in their abilities to communicate. Therefore, it is an essential [基本的/必要的] part of the curriculum.

part3.question: Do you think a child's relationship with friends can be replaced by that with parents?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] In my view, no, they are fundamentally different. [Reason] Friends offer equality and fun, while parents offer guidance [指导] and safety to them during their growth years. [Example] Although parents are Supportive [支持的], a Fair-weather friend [酒肉朋友] teaches you resilience. You need both in life to be fully well-rounded [全面发展的] and socially capable. They serve distinct but equally important functions for a child.

part3.question: Has social media changed the definition of "friendship" in modern society?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] Regrettably, it has made connections more Superficial [肤浅的]. [Reason] We call strangers "friends" online without knowing them at all or meeting them in person ever. [Example] Unless we meet offline, we cannot build a Lifelong [终身的] bond of trust. A friend in need is a friend indeed [患难见真情], not just a like button.

part3.question: Is it possible to maintain a lifelong friendship despite living in different countries?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] Absolutely [绝对地], if both sides make a real effort. [Reason] True friends stay connected Through thick and thin [风雨同舟] via frequent video calls and messaging apps daily. [Example] Even if they Drift apart [逐渐疏远] briefly, they can See eye to eye [看法一致] instantly when they meet. Distance is just a number for true friends who love each other.
